articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kirill Myshkin)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Hristo Chakarov)
articles.description: With so many image editing services available nowadays, itâ€™s good to have one good solution that is applicable for all websites and web apps that need to provide image editing as a feature. articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: In this article, Andy Budd shares his way of requesting feedback: rather than sharing a linear case study that explains every design revision, the first thing to do would be to better frame the problem.
articles.title: How Designers Should Ask For (And Receive) High-Quality Feedback

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast we ask how has the design industry changed? Is technology making our work easier? Vitaly Friedman talks to veteran designer Veerle Pieters to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 56 With Veerle Pieters: How Has The Design Industry Changed?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jennifer Brehm)
articles.description: Web development, especially what you can do with CSS, has become increasingly complex. With the added capabilities of CSS Grid, it is now possible to achieve layouts that look like they were laid out by hand. Letâ€™s tackle a practical example of how to do something like that.
articles.title: How To Build A Magazine Layout With CSS Grid Areas

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Podcasts are a fantastic opportunity to get up close with the people who know their craft. In this post, we compiled podcasts that are bound to provide valuable insights into UX and new perspectives on the field. Perfect for a short coffee break or a long commute.
articles.title: UX Podcasts For Designers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
